presentations.name: Google Assistant workshop - Learn to make your own assistant skill
presentations.description: In this workshop we will look at the Google Assistant and what we can do with it. Everyone will at the end have made their own skill that they can use from their phone, speaker or hub.

presentations.name: Public Speaking Workshop - Learn how to give your first tech talk
presentations.description: In this workshop we wanted to put focus on how to get started with public speaking. How to approach it, how to come up with ideas, how to write it down and how to present it. This was in collaboration with Zoey Chow.

presentations.name: JavaScript testing workshop - learn how to write test
presentations.description: In this workshop I gave a presentation and help the workshop students learn how to get started writing test in JavaScript. It was a really great workshop where getting the hang of it and hands-on was the goal as hearing about testing theory doesn't make you good at testing only. This was in collaboration with Mohsen Asfia.

presentations.name: Learn GraphQL with JavaScript Workshop
presentations.description: In this workshop, we will look at GraphQL as frontend developers and learn how to use GraphQL to make a single page application. GraphQL is a really awesome toolkit to talk to APIs much more conveniently. Knowing it, you can really create an awesome user experience with much quicker speed and much less code.

presentations.name: Build your first blockchain app with JS & Ethereum
presentations.description: I gave a workshop on how to get started with the Ethereum blockchain. We start with looking at mobile wallets and then we try to deploy our first smart contract with Remix. In the end we try to make our first dapp that uses the mobile wallet.

presentations.name: Build your first blockchain app with JS & Ethereum
presentations.description: I gave a workshop on how to get started with the Ethereum blockchain. We start with looking at mobile wallets and then we try to deploy our first smart contract with Remix. In the end we try to make our first dapp that uses the mobile wallet.

presentations.name: WebUSB: Making a label printer work in the browser
presentations.description: I learnt how to use WebUSB when I had a task to make label printing easy. I want to share with you what webusb is and how you can use it. I also implemented a printer driver in javascript so that I can print to a label printer directly from the browser. The happy future of easily connecting to custom hardware is close!

presentations.name: Getting started with Kubernetes on Google Cloud
presentations.location: Google Cloud Developer Community Copenhagen - Copenhagen - 21. Marts 2019
presentations.description: I gave a four hour workshop were we got into Kubernetes and deployed a docker container to Google Cloud Kubernetes Engine. We used Cloud Build to build our container and push it to GCR.

presentations.name: Getting started with Kubernetes on Google Cloud
presentations.location: Google Cloud Developer Community Madrid - Madrid - 16. Marts 2019
presentations.description: I gave a four hour workshop were we got into Kubernetes and deployed a docker container to Google Cloud Kubernetes Engine. We used Cloud Build to build our container and push it to GCR.

presentations.name: Making your own game in JavaScript
presentations.description: A GameJam is an event where everyone is working on creating a new game and sharing the enthusiasm for making.

presentations.name: How a labelprinter can help your Community
presentations.description: I gave a talk to a room of organizers why a labelprinter could help them in their work as a organizer. How it can take something from the conference experience and bring it down to the community meetups

presentations.name: Introduction to Kubernetes KNative
presentations.description: Serverless is coming on Kubernetes and KNative is a serious response from Google to run ontop of Kubernetes. KNative is a serverless framework that makes it so easy to spin up and run containers on demand with all the benefits of Kubernetes and Istio.

presentations.name: How to create a good CV
presentations.description: In this workshop presentation I tell how to create a good CV, what should it include and what should you leave out. A CV is a conversation starter and how to connect with companies in the best ways to get oppotunities.

presentations.name: Intro to Kubernetes workshop
presentations.location: Google Cloud Community Copenhagen - Copenhagen - 11. October 2018
presentations.description: I made the first non-profit paid workshop where I taught Kubernetes to with practical examples. In the workshop the participants got to deploy their own application first with the Kubectl CLI and then made it with the YAML files in the declaritive way.

presentations.name: How Kubernetes allows your Startup to scale
presentations.description: With Kubernetes you can scale your startup easier with an easier way to hire talent. In this presentation, I show you how Kubernetes is the right choice.

presentations.name: How to build a P2P Chat
presentations.description: In this workshop, we will look at how we can use p2p libraries to give our applications real-time chat and allow games to be multiplayer. We will be building a chat application and a multiplayer game both with JavaScript. One of the major benefits of p2p is it is really cost-effective since you don't have to pay for hosting. The libraries we are going to use is called IPFS and Webtorrent, which both have large communities and active development.

presentations.name: Building P2P in the browser for zero cost
presentations.description: How would you build a peer to peer app on the web and what are some of the challenges? We will look at how to take advance of new libraries that makes it easy to make cool new applications like games and chat.

presentations.name: Contributing to Open Source Workshop
presentations.description: A workshop about how to contribute to open source and some workshop questions to think about and discuss in a group. Finish it up with time for starting that process.

presentations.name: Using React-Native to launch iOS and Android in record time
presentations.description: We made a React-Native app at Connected Cars, but how did it go and what are the upsides and downsides now after it has been launched? What could be done better?

presentations.name: Greeting you with Vision and Speech Machine Learning
presentations.description: I talked about how you can use Machine Learning for recognizing faces and names with Machine Learning.

presentations.name: Introduction to Docker for Developers
presentations.description: I talked about how you can use Machine Learning for recognizing faces and names with Machine Learning.

presentations.name: Docker Best Practices in development and Production
presentations.description: You should come if you know or have tried Docker but are thinking about how to get more serious about containers. What are the best practices with docker in Development, Staging and Production with regards to security.

presentations.name: Making Docker and Kubernetes a success at your Company
presentations.description: We will talk about the benefits and downsides of using Kubernetes and how to take docker and kubernetes from theory to practice as your company. Story of how we took Connected Cars from nothing to a full self-serving platform in one year.

presentations.name: WebVR with the Oculus Go
presentations.description: How does the Oculus Go work and what is WebVR together with it? I show how you can make a duck shooting game in 2 hours with A-frame and how the new React-360 compares. I also show how the Oculus Go works and how it is playing a game by livestreaming to my laptop with Facebook Live.

presentations.name: How to stay secure/anonymouse in a modern age
presentations.description: I gave a 20 minutes presentation about how to communicate and browse securely, how to use tor and using encryption easily with Keybase.io

presentations.name: Serverless workshop
presentations.description: I gave a practical workshop on how to use AWS Lambda and API Gateway where everybody got to deploy their own serverless workshop.

presentations.name: What I learned teaching workshops
presentations.description: I gave a talk about what I learned giving workshops at the Docker meetup group and some tips and tricks to do it better.

presentations.name: How to not burn out as a Organizer
presentations.description: A talk about learning and ideas for being a meetup organizer through my experience running CopenhagenJS and Docker Copenhagen for 3 years.

presentations.name: How to do Serverless
presentations.description: An introduction on how to think about serverless and a demo of how to deploy with AWS and Google Cloud in both under 10 minutes.

presentations.name: What is Cloud Native
presentations.description: A gave a 25 min presentation about Cloud Native and what it means.

presentations.name: Introduction to Docker
presentations.description: I gave a 2 hours introduction to docker and a live code demo.

presentations.name: Creating an intelligent Facebook bot
presentations.description: I showed how to make a facebook messenger bot that used speech recognition.

presentations.name: How to be an awesome developer and get paid well at the same time!
presentations.description: What does it take to be an awesome developer and how do you ensure you get paid well.

presentations.name: Learn to be a DevOps - Workshop
presentations.description: A workshop that teaches the flow of continuous integration and continuous deployment.

presentations.name: Distributed file system with IPFS
presentations.description: A presentation about distributed hash tables, hashing of files and hands on use of IPFS.

presentations.name: React Workshop
presentations.description: Made a workshop on how to get started with React and the attendees made a contact formular.

presentations.name: Universal Apps - The good, the bad and the ugly
presentations.description: My experiences on developing universal apps and what to do and what not to do.

presentations.name: How to deploy with Docker
presentations.description: I showed how to deploy a website from scracth with Docker.

presentations.name: Docker Introduction - What you need to know
presentations.description: Talked about why Docker matters and the reason why it is a billion dollar company. Showed a demo on how to use Docker.

presentations.name: Swarm 1.1 release and Introduction
presentations.description: Showed the newest version of Docker, including that of rescheduling of containers.

presentations.name: Kubernetes Introduction - Workshop 3 hours
presentations.description: Made a workshop with 5 scenarios on how to use Kubernetes, from launching a Kubernetes cluster on your own computer to the hardest scenario of launching a fault-tolerant Redis cluster.

presentations.name: Introduction to HTML and CSS
presentations.description: Prepared a introduction to learn a group of girls how to think in HTML, "everything is a square" and the semantic of html tags.

presentations.name: How do you survive key-loss with Docker?
presentations.description: Gave a thorough guide on how docker hub can survive a key loss with their Docker Notary project. Talking about how they switch out root keys and their standard they have published.

presentations.name: JavaScript Jeopardy
presentations.description: Prepared a 30 multiple-choice about everything from founders of projects to how to change the inline style of a element with basic JavaScript.

presentations.name: Introduction to Docker - Workshop
presentations.description: Gave a 3-hour introduction to Docker about everything you need to know. We talked about why it mattered and how to get started with Docker on their next project.

presentations.name: The land of Isomorphic Apps
presentations.description: Talked about my experience creating a universal app. What to do and especially what not to do!

presentations.name: Face Recognition on old pictures
presentations.description: During a hackathon, I worked on doing facial recognition and then gave a presentation on what I found interesting with the results and how to get started with it.

presentations.name: Introduction to webtorrent
presentations.description: I had been hacking around with webtorrent and gave a talk about this project. I showed some small projects that I have made and explained the concept of webtorrent and what made it work.

presentations.name: Lessons learnt building with Reflux.js
presentations.description: I talked about lesson learned working with Reflux.js, a simple flux implementation. I showed why a unidirectional flow was a positive thing for both the development and debugging part of web development.

presentations.name: Docker Hosting - How to ship those containers?
presentations.description: We all love containers, but what are the actually easiest ways to get started hosting those containers online. I showed an example on how to get started with hosting containers on Tutum (now Docker Cloud).

presentations.name: Firespeed prototyping with Firebase
presentations.description: I had been working on Firebase some time and showed how it was awesome for small and quick prototypes where you wanted something awesome quick.

presentations.name: 20 minutes Super Mario
presentations.description: I showed how you could build a Super Mario clone in literally 20 minutes of time with Crafty.js and all the built in modules.
